result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Sentencing hearing on November 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Motion to Adjourn Sentencing

11:10 AM Defendant Alanna J. Sanchez in court, in custody.  Attorney David Vernon Penn in court for Alanna J. Sanchez.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorneys reach agreement. Plea of guilty entered. Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Court finds that defendant is knowingly and voluntarily waiving right to jury trial and plea is found to be entered knowingly and voluntarily.  Found guilty.  Court remands defendant to Vilas County Sheriff's Department Jail.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea hearing on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Defendant Alanna J. Sanchez appeared by video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Alanna J. Sanchez.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Set for plea hearing on June 22, 2022 at 11:00 a.m. Bond continues.
Status conference on May 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

Defendant Alanna J. Sanchez appeared by video from the Vilas County Jail.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Alanna J. Sanchez.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Penn would like more time and requests a status conference.  Court sets status conference for May 26, 2022 at 3:30 p.m.  Bond continues.

Defendant Alanna J. Sanchez appeared by video, in custody.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin not in court.  Attorney David Vernon Penn appeared by video for Alanna J. Sanchez.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin.  Court adjourns hearing for one week.  Bond continued.
Status hearing scheduled for May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Status hearing on May 18, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status hearing on May 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
No contact with Matthew Joles, Jacob Bickford, Joseph Beson, Aaron Wilde, and Charlene Bickford, and mental health evaluation before being released.
Status hearing on March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Penn by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre -trial for March 15th at 8:30 am and sets status hearing for March 24th at 8:30 am. Court amends bond to $4000.00 cash bond. Conditions, No contact with Matthew Joles, Jacob Bickford, Joseph Beson, Aaron Wilde, and Charlene Bickford, and mental health evaluation before being released.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Penn by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds defendant is making a knowing and voluntary waiver of right to preliminary examination.  Court finds probable cause.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  State files information in court and provides copies to defense.  Defense waives reading of information.  Not guilty plea entered by court.  Bond continued. Court sets pre -trial for May 10th at 11:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Preliminary hearing on February 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail with Attorney Penn by zoom. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Penn received complaint and requests a preliminary hearing. Court sets preliminary hearing for February 14th at 1:30 pm. bond continued.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has received complaint. Court adjourns initial appearance to February 9th at 1:00 pm. bond continued.
No contact with Matthew Joles, Jacob Bickford, Joseph Beson, Aaron Wilde, and Charlene Bickford.

Defendant appears by video in the Vilas County Jail without counsel. DA Hayes appears in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court find probable cause the criminal activity has been made. Court quashes warrant and sets $5000.00 cash bond. Conditions, No contact with Matthew Joles, Jacob Bickford, Joseph Beson, Aaron Wilde, and Charlene Bickford. Court sets initial appearance for February 7th at 1:00 pm.
